item.title: Read Last Week - Everybody loves Facebook !

item.description:
BBC on Cambridge Analytica

Tech giant Facebook and data analytics firm Cambridge Analytica are at the centre of a dispute over the harvesting and use of personal dat

 

BGR on Slingshot

A nation-state developed a piece of malware so powerful that it can steal everything that’s happening on a computer without even being install on the target device itself. Instead, it resides on a router. It’s called Slingshot and it was recently discovered by Kaspersky Labs. Incredibly, the malware is so powerful and sophisticated that it hid in routers for six years before finally being spotted

item.title: Read last week - MoviePass
item.description:
Wow

MoviePass CEO Mitch Lowe told an audience at a Hollywood event last Friday that the app tracks moviegoers’ locations before and after each show they watch. “We get an enormous amount of information,”

Hardcoded Password Found in Cisco Software

item.title: Read last week
item.description:
The economist on “self driving cars”

Particularly interesting is this part regarding privacy “AVs will record everything that happens in and around them. When a crime is committed, the police will ask nearby cars if they saw anything. Fleet operators will know a great deal about their riders”.
